discourse_list.title: Collateral Onboarding Call #41: Oasis Pro Markets MIP6s AMA

content.content: Collateral Onboarding Call #41: Oasis Pro Markets MIP6s AMA  India Power Green Bonds + Financing for ATD Combustors’ Egyptian Power Plant Efficiency Projects  Intro For the 41st Collateral Onboarding Call, we will have a collateral double feature🍿. Oasis Pro Markets will host a community AMA on their two MIP6 applications for Real-world Assets.  MIP6: Financing for ATD Combustor’s Egyptian Power Plant Efficiency Projects MIP6: India Power Green Bonds  Join us 2022-04-26T18:00:00Z as we host key team members from @OasisProTeam to explore these opportunities for MakerDAO, and answer any of the community’s questions.   Pat LaVecchia - Oasis Pro Markets CEO   Renuka Gupta - Oasis Pro Markets Chief Regulatory Officer   Walker McKeough - Oasis Pro Markets Associate    Agenda    Intro by @juan & @retro  Presentation by @OasisProTeam  Community Q&A   [MIP6: Financing for ATD Combustor’s Egyptian Power Plant Efficiency Projects]   This MIP6 is submitted by Oasis Pro, as advisor, to propose a new asset for the Real World Asset Core Unit involving the Note(s) issued by ATDC. Subsequent to the issuance of the Bonds and to facilitate liquidity and market-based valuation, the Bonds, as well as equity of the Company, could be listed on Oasis Pro’s alternative trading system. While this MIP6 is for a $35mm financing, the opportunity to fund additional green projects in Egypt and other countries in the Middle East could be as much as $500mm - $1bn. Real World Asset Proposed: Note(s) secured by the Security Guarantor and Collateral. The Note(s) will be full recourse obligations to ATDC and the Security Guarantor. Established in 2014, ATDC is registered in the UAE and has operations in Egypt and the UAE. ATDC is engaged in the development of state-of-the-art clean technology for power generation, the execution of energy savings and performance enhancing projects to reduce energy costs. ATDC’s application-based R&D and combustion technology expertise are utilized to design and develop conventional, hybrid and renewable customized solutions for power generation. ATDC also provides energy optimization of plant performance, the operation and maintenance of sustainable solutions for power generation and energy and water savings for industrial facilities, buildings, and large venues.   MIP6: India Power Green Bonds   This MIP6 is submitted by Oasis Pro, as advisor to IPCL. IPCL has its registered office in Kolkata, India. The Company was granted a license to distribute electricity across 771 sq. kms. in Asansol - Ranigunj areas of West Bengal in 1932 and since then the Company has been a dedicated power supplier to the region, driving economic and social growth by supplying quality power to government utilities, hospitals, industries, mines, commercial and domestic consumers. As of financial year 2020-21, the Company distributes electricity over a license area of 771 sq. kms. The Company has transformed itself through modern technology such as SCADA, IoT enabled Distribution Transformer health monitoring, AMR / Prepaid enabled meters, 24x7 call center and data analytics, online prepaid recharge facilities for almost all the customers. Real World Asset Proposed: One or more senior secured fixed rate bonds or other indebtedness (Bonds) secured by collateral with full recourse to IPCL, ranking pari passu with other senior secured debt of IPCL. IPCL has also interest into generation of electricity primarily through renewable energy sources. Current Portfolio includes total generation capacity of around 39 MW comprising 24.8 MW from wind asset in Gujarat, 2 MW from solar assets in West Bengal and 12 MW from thermal power plant at Asansol, West Bengal.   When Time in your local-timezone format: 2022-04-26T18:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where Crowdcast Call   crowdcast    Collateral Onboarding Call #41 | Oasis Pro Markets MIP6s AMA Register now for Collateral Onboarding Call #41 | Oasis Pro Markets MIP6s AMA on crowdcast, scheduled to go live on April 26, 2022, 01:00 PM CDT.       Attn: @SES-Core-Unit, @gov-comms-core-unit, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Growth-Core-Unit, @daif-core-unit, @Protocol-Engineering, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @Real-World-Finance, @strat-fin-core-unit, @Recognized-Delegates

Collateral Onboarding Call - Episode #41  April 26th, 2022  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Retro  00:44: Oasis Pro Markets MIP6s with Renuka Gupta and Walker McKeough  17:50: Q&A and Discussion about Oasis Pro Markets MIP6s   Video https://youtu.be/xFryn0W5DXc  Introduction  Retro  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Welcome everyone to episode #41 of the Collateral Onboarding Call. I am Retro from the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling CU. Today, we are hosting a collateral double feature. I am joined by Renuka, and Walker, from Oasis Pro Markets to discuss their two MIP6s applications involving the onboarding of RWA. According to the collateral status index, both applications are currently in the application stage, and their green light polls are scheduled to go live on May 2nd. Discussions about collateral happen in the Forum.    Oasis Pro Markets MIP6s AMA  Oasis Pro Markets MIP6s AMA   Renuka Gupta  Presentation 00:44  Oasis Pro Markets1629×920 63.1 KB   Oasis Pro1629×925 112 KB   Oasis Pro1630×920 188 KB   MIP6: ATD Combustors(UAE)1628×929 208 KB   MIP6: ATD Combustors Egyptian Efficiency & Tech Projects1630×924 200 KB   MIP6: ATDC Notes Issuance1631×926 217 KB   MIP6: India Power1625×919 164 KB   MIP6: India Power Commitment to Renewables1627×924 150 KB   MIP6: India Power Green Bonds1627×918 239 KB   Discussion 17:50 - Eric Rapp: We would like to see a thoughtful discussion of how the real world would structure and price this risk. What are reasonable comparable transactions, and how were they structured and priced? 20:32 - Teej: Regarding the ATDC deal, the collateral is both the receivables from the services agreement and an interest in a USD account that pulls up to 60% of energy cost savings? 22:34 - Eric Rapp: What are the details on the servicing contract and energy savings mechanism backing this transaction? How are these cashflows being allocated? 23:53 - Kianga Daverington: What form of guarantee is being provided by the individual? Is it given in his/her natural name or an entity? What is the governing law for this guarantee? 24:56 - Christian Petersen: Has India Power had any preliminary discussions with the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on USD access for debt repayment? 27:07 - Kianga Daverington: Will someone at MakerDAO be able to verify the guarantor’s assets? What kind of diligence can we perform here? 29:56 - Teej: Is there any reason to think that a market rate should not be equivalent to the outstanding rate as long as the credit rating of IPCL has not changed? 33:15 - Teej: These are emerging market and energy assets; esoteric assets. A methodology would be helpful and required for token holders to take these risks. 37:39 - Eric Rapp: The community would like to know where the market is and what is reasonable. It is easier to think about how and where the community would want to bid versus where the market is. 39:50 - ElPro: I read about risk-sharing agreements in project financing between parties, such as a power purchase agreement (PPA). Is that possible with any of these two MIPs? I also heard about an EHCC subsidiary known as an ETCC that uses a build-own-operate. Is this the case with ADT? 42:49 - Retro: What is the best way to get a hold of you?  Closing Comment   Retro 46:18  Thank you to Oasis Pro Markets for the work on the MIPs and for making yourselves available today. We look forward to seeing how the green light poll goes.   Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary.  @Gala produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
